com.apple.audio.util
Class CAMemoryObject

java.lang.Object
  com.apple.audio.CAObject
      com.apple.audio.util.CAMemoryObject
Direct Known Subclasses:
AudioBuffer, AudioBufferList, AudioStreamDescription, AudioTimeStamp, AudioUnitConnection, AudioValueRange, AudioValueTranslation, AUParameter, AUParameterInfo, ExtendedControlEvent, ExtendedNoteOnEvent, ExtendedNoteParams, ExtendedTempoEvent, MIDIData, MIDINotification, MIDIPacket, MIDIPacketList, MIDISysexSendRequest, MusicUserEvent, ParameterEvent, SMPTETime
public class CAMemoryObject
extends CAObject

A CAMemoryObject represents a region of memory. Various methods provide access to the contents of the memory that is represented by this class, and all of those access calls are bounds checked against the known allocation size.

Constructor Summary
CAMemoryObject(int size, boolean clear)
          Constructor that allocates a block of size bytes of memory.

Constructor Detail

CAMemoryObject

public CAMemoryObject(int size,
                      boolean clear)
Constructor that allocates a block of size bytes of memory.

Parameters:
size - the size of memory needed.
clear - if true the memory is cleared to zeros, if false the memory is uninitialized.
Method Detail

copyFromTo

public static void copyFromTo(CAMemoryObject src,
                              int srcOffset,
                              CAMemoryObject dest,
                              int destOffset,
                              int numBytesToCopy)
                       throws CAOutOfBoundsException
Copy the numBytes from the source object starting at srcOffset bytes into that object to the destination object starting at destOffset.

Parameters:
src - the source object to copy from
srcOffset - the number of bytes from the start of the source object to start copying from
dest - the destination object to copy the memory to.
destOffset - the number of bytes from the start of the destination object to copy too.
numBytesToCopy - the number of bytes to copy
Throws:
CAOutOfBoundsException - if there is not enough room in either object

getSize

public int getSize()
Returns the size in bytes of the Memory Object.

public final void copyToArray(int srcOffset,
                              byte[] destArray,
                              int destOffset,
                              int numBytesToCopy)
An efficient byte[] copy that copies numBytesToCopy from the memory object to the byte array.

Parameters:
srcOffset - the byte offset from the memory object to copy the bytes from
destArray - the destination byte array
destOffset - the offset within the byte array to start copying to
numBytesToCopy - the number of bytes to copy

                                byte[] srcArray,
                                int srcOffset,
                                int numBytesToCopy)

numBytesToCopy - how many elements of the byte array to copy

getCStringAt

public java.lang.String getCStringAt(int offset)
Presumes that the specified part of the object is a C string - ie. ASCII encoded byte values - and returns this as a java.lang.String object. A length value of zero will scan from the offset memory location until the first value of zero (or the size of the object) is found.

Parameters:
offset - the byte offset where the CString begins
Returns:
a String

getCFStringAt

public CAFString getCFStringAt(int offset)
Presumes that the specified part of the object is a CFString - ie. Unicode values - and returns this as a CAFString object.

Parameters:
offset - the byte offset where the CFString begins
Returns:
a CAFString
